column4: I've got a strange problem with ssh and the tun driver. When i execute "ssh -w 0:0 somehost.company.nl" the tun is available at the client. But on the server there is no tun device.

Then i started searching. Tried for 2 days a couple of things. But it's not working. With the following script: http://gentoo-wiki.com/HOWTO_VPN_over_SSH_and_tun I get this erros: http://pastebin.com/d627dfb0a
don't use gentoo guides on ubuntu
on a gentoo device we got the same problems.
still, don't use gentoo docs on ubuntu
i'd started with this. https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SSH_VPN
apologies, I just lost connection
there was an interesting bug I was working on with someone earlier in the week where /dev/net/tun can't have it's udev rules overwritten, ~I wonder if this is related
it's possable that it's some kind of bug somewhere.
yes, I was having quite a hard time with the users problem, I was able to re-create it, it still in my development environment and on the list to fix
it may not be related though
but the main part is that someone else has the same problem, but then from a gentoo device.
is the problem always with the server end
so far i can see is the problem indeed always on the server
then I'd assume thats a bug with the actual software (big assumption)
with edgy as ssh server. and hardy as ssh client it will create a tun0 device on the server
i'm searching for a gutsy server at the moment
thats interesting.....
nope. i don't have any feitsy/gutsy servers. only a few edgy servers left. the rest is on hardy.
I may setup one up myself to test the other issue I was looking at, as they may be releated.
ok. i had enouch of it. then i'll only forward one port for zabbix instead of building a simple VPN. no tun driver at this point. thanks for the help so far :)
thats not funny or appropriate
i don't care. i diddn't develop/choose that name.
